definition: old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)
to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity
heroically sacrificing one's life (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause
sacrificing one's life generously (idiom); to sacrifice oneself fervently to the cause

sentences.english: For people praying for you is a byproduct of yourgenerosity.
sentences.chinese: 因为人们为你祷告是你慷慨大方的一个副产品。

sentences.english: The magister has been kind enough to provide us with suitable gifts.
sentences.chinese: 总督已经很慷慨的为我们准备了合适的礼物了。

sentences.english: And you've confirmed once again the fundamental decency and generosity of the American people,” Obama said.
sentences.chinese: 你们再现了美国人民最本质的礼尚和慷慨。

sentences.english: Generously padded footbed massages the foot with each and every step.
sentences.chinese: 慷慨填充鞋垫按摩脚每一步。

sentences.english: Thus another form of generosity is sharing the Word of God.
sentences.chinese: 因此，另一种慷慨大方的形式就是分享神的道。

sentences.english: They make believe to be generous, but they gave him only two-pence.
sentences.chinese: 他们装出十分慷慨的样子，但只给了两便士。

sentences.english: "Not many things contribute to our happiness more than generosity," says Tal Ben-Shahar, Ph.
sentences.chinese: 比慷慨更能带给我们幸福感的事情并不多。

sentences.english: In Chinese society very few fairy godmothers can be discovered.
sentences.chinese: 在中国社会里，很少有钱的女人慷慨捐助。

sentences.english: The Guinean government and people thank for China's years of disinterested and generous assistance.
sentences.chinese: 几政府和人民感谢中方多年来给予几的无私慷慨帮助。

sentences.english: "What is Hollywood culture?" Wen Xianglin saw Wen Xiang had become righteously indignant , and this so alarmed her that she was unsure what to do.
sentences.chinese: 文湘琳见文祥慷慨激昂的样子，吓得有点不知所措。

sentences.english: Let us not give too generously to beggars either.
sentences.chinese: 让我们不要给予乞丐太多的慷慨。

sentences.english: This generous wine feels softer when paired with the Sautéed Rice with Seafood and Thailand Shrimp Paste.
sentences.chinese: 这慷慨的酒和泰式虾膏海鲜炒饭搭配时显得温柔一些。

sentences.english: Also, you have to make a charitable contribution to gain entry to these types of parties.
sentences.chinese: 而且，你还得慷慨解囊，方能参加这种慈善宴会。

sentences.english: It stands for the spirit of hard work and unselfishness.
sentences.chinese: 它代表的精神是努力工作和慷慨。

sentences.english: Send an e-mail. Write a letter.
sentences.chinese: 打个电话，发封邮件，写封信，营造一种慷慨的生活。

sentences.english: However, sometimes nature’s bounty is not enough.
sentences.chinese: 然而有时候大自然的慷慨是不够的。

definition: to contribute generously (idiom); help sb generously with money/to give generously to charity
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
hospitality/to treat guests well/to enjoy having guests/hospitable/friendly
lit. to loosen one's purse/fig. to give generously to help others
to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
not to stint/to be generous (with praise etc)/to be prepared to (pay a fee, give of one's time etc)
to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
